org.transitime.applications

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.applications.Core

  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for running a Transitime Core real-time data processing system. Handles command line arguments and then initiates AVL feed.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

      • getTime

        public Time getTime()
        For when want to use methods in Time. This is important when need methods that access a Calendar a lot. By putting the Calendar in Time it can be shared.
        Returns:

      • getSystemTime

        public SystemTime getSystemTime()
        For when need system time but might be in playback mode
        Returns:

      • getLogger

        public static final org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
        Returns the Core logger so that each class doesn't need to create its own and have it be configured properly.
        Returns:

      • inPlaybackMode

        public static boolean inPlaybackMode()
        Returns true if in playback mode, indicating that shouldn't be running AVL feeds nor logging data to db.
        Returns:

      • inBatchGtfsRealtimeMode

        public static boolean inBatchGtfsRealtimeMode()
        Returns true if in batch GTFS-realtime mode. This means that shouldn't be running realtime AVL feeds. Instead, the AVL data will come from a single batch file. Useful for the World Bank project where want to determine departure times from historic GPS data and update the schedule times in the GTFS stop_times.txt file to make them more accurate.
        Returns:

      • getDbLogger

        public DataDbLogger getDbLogger()
        Returns the DataDbLogger for logging data to db.
        Returns:

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main program that runs the entire Transitime application.!

        args -
